are considered at high risk 
of anaemia, for example, if you:
• had anaemia before 
pregnancy
• are having twins or more
• have a gap of less than a 
year between pregnancies
• do not eat enough foods 
that contain iron
• suffer	from	hyperemesis	
(excessive vomiting in 
pregnancy)
• suffer	from	bleeding	of	
any cause during the 
pregnancy.
What does it mean if I have 
iron deficiency anaemia?
It is important to detect and 
treat	iron	deficiency	anaemia

pregnancy t
